Description: St Antony seated at his desk with an open book and a crucifix; a woman, with monstrous ears, seen holding an urn; monsters seen on either side; a troop of monstrous creatures seen behind to right and a village in flames. Engraving
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1330) (Wierix)
Mauquoy-Hendrickx 1979 / Les Estampes des Wierix ... catalogue raisonné (1066)
Alvin 1866 / Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre des trois frères Jan, Jérome et Antoine Wierix (849)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
